definition: forehead/horizontal tablet or inscribed board/specified number or amount

sentences.english: But high taxes do not always mean expensive cigarettes.
sentences.chinese: 高額菸草稅不總能讓煙價高不可攀。

sentences.english: Some homeowners are delinquent, or unable to make the payments on costly, exotic mortgages they took out during the boom.
sentences.chinese: 一些屋主拖欠債務，或者無力支付高額的按揭款。

sentences.english: They invited those pop stars to the ceremony at vast expense.
sentences.chinese: 他們以高額酬金把那些歌星請到了這次的典禮上來。

sentences.english: An unusually high amount of savings comes from large companies in China's corporate sector.
sentences.chinese: 超乎尋常的高額儲蓄來自中國的大企業。

sentences.english: Gongmeng was unable to pay the huge amount of fine.
sentences.chinese: 面對高額處罰，公盟表示無力支付。

sentences.english: Thee U. S. government imposed a high tariff on foreign products to maintain profitability.
sentences.chinese: 美國政府爲了保持盈利對外國產品徵收高額關稅。

sentences.english: The Internet search giant incurred somewhat higher expenses driven by legal costs.
sentences.chinese: 該搜索巨頭在訴訟費用上產生了高額費用。

sentences.english: The highest scholarship went to a postgraduate majoring in physics.
sentences.chinese: 最高額的獎學金頒給了一位物理研究生。

sentences.english: The monopoly profit was made from the channels because of industry control.
sentences.chinese: 該渠道以前受到國家行業控制，呈現高額壟斷利潤。

sentences.english: For starters, DreamWorks pays Universal hefty rent.
sentences.chinese: 作爲進駐的工作室，夢工廠付了高額租金。

sentences.english: Only one other job in the Army, Special Forces, rates such a super-sized retention bonus.
sentences.chinese: 部隊中只有特種部隊享有如此高額獎金。

sentences.english: Never ask for a large salary or big-budget perks.
sentences.chinese: 絕對不能要求高薪或者高額補貼。

sentences.english: Right now, the high housing prices have become a heavy burden that people cannnot stand in their life.
sentences.chinese: 如今高額的房價已成爲人們生活中不可承受之重。

sentences.english: Killing endangered species is punishable by a 12-year prison term and stiff fines.
sentences.chinese: 殺害瀕臨絕種物種可處12年有期徒刑及高額罰款。

sentences.english: Usury Illegal practice of charging an excessively high interest rate on loans.
sentences.chinese: 高利貸對貸款收取高額利息的非法操作。

sentences.english: Months of murderous interest payments gobbled up my savings.
sentences.chinese: 所有積蓄也被幾個月下來的可怕的高額利息蠶食一空。

definition: restitution/return of something to its original owner/remittance
to reduce or waive (taxes, punishment, rent, tuition etc)
life insurance/abbr. for 人壽保險|人寿保险
hook (on which to hang sth)/to couple/to link together/to establish contact with/hook/coupling links (e.g. between two railway coaches)
to borrow or lend money/debit and credit items on a balance sheet
